title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 145-1.5 - Prevention of invasions of privacy
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 145-1.5 - Prevention of invasions of privacy

State Regulations

In accordance with the provisions of subdivision 2 of
section
89
of the

Public Officers Law and in conformity with guidelines promulgated by the

Committee on Open Government regarding the prevention of unwarranted invasions
of personal privacy, the records access officer may delete from any record
identifying details, the disclosure of which would result in an unwarranted
invasion of personal privacy prior to making such record available for
inspection and/or copying. In the event that one deletion or more is so made
from any document, the records access officer shall provide written notice of
that fact to the person given access to the record. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
145-1.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
